text: The law also requires voters in a do-over to vote in the same primary -- R or D -- as they did the 1st time. For an election coming a full year after the original, after lots of voters have switched parties/forgotten whom they voted for, it's a recipe for mass confusion. #nc09 /5
author: AmyEGardner

text: There is also a constitutional question about the legality of the NCGA writing a statute *during* an election. State courts struck down a law last year written during similar circumstances but having to do with judicial elections. /4
author: AmyEGardner

text: But the legislature forgot to change some other existing language in the statute that says that in the event of a new primary, the candidates have to be the same for the primary too. So ... Harris versus Pittenger -- remember him? -- plus a third guy named Clarence Goins. /3
author: AmyEGardner

text: Those who've been following this story know that the GOP-controlled NC General Assembly passed a law in December demanding a primary if there's going to be a new general. It was a way to get Harris out of the way if the fraud scandal consumed him, as it did last month. #nc09 /2
author: AmyEGardner

text: Could be some interesting news out of Raleigh today, where the State Board of Elections is scheduled to set the dates for a special election in #nc09 -- and could choose to call for a new general, no primary, same candidates. In other words a McCready-Harris rematch. /1
author: AmyEGardner

text: Here’s the latest from @PostScottWilson’s unsurpassed California Chronicles, about the water under the Mojave, the company with Trump ties that wants to tap it and what @GavinNewsom, who promised to bridge CA’s urban-agri water divide, will do about it.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Todd Johnson, the 2016 congressional candidate who hired McCrae Dowless and won all but five mail ballots in the primary that year in Bladen County — as has been explained in a million articles — tells WRAL yesterday he had never noticed those skewed results.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Key takeaways on #nc09 in new write-thru: 1) Raleigh DA says this is a "large-scope" investigation w months of scrutiny & more charges ahead. 2) Her top target is “who was aware of & helped finance" Dowless. 3) Mark Harris should be worried.

text: At one point in negotiations, Harris lawyer David Freedman mentioned Harris's meds. Board counsel Josh Lawson angrily replied that Harris could not blame the likely perjury on his meds unless he planned to list them with documentation of their effects.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Lawyers for the board -- and for Harris -- saw an opportunity to put an end to the ordeal when they realized the evangelical minister might be perjuring himself. Under serious legal jeopardy, he declared the election was tainted -- and that pushed the board to a 5-0 vote.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Some juicy details: The two Republicans on the state elections board weren't immediately convinced to vote for a new election, even after Mark Harris admitted he had not told the truth under oath. https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/in-nc-a-surprise-in-the-end-everyone-agreed-it-was-election-fraud/2019/02/22/52e9f226-36c5-11e9-854a-7a14d7fec96a_story.html?utm_term=.0b508caecfeb …
author: AmyEGardner

text: Hey early birds! Here's my behind-the-scenes take from North Carolina: How a new election in #nc09 almost didn't happen   https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/in-nc-a-surprise-in-the-end-everyone-agreed-it-was-election-fraud/2019/02/22/52e9f226-36c5-11e9-854a-7a14d7fec96a_story.html?utm_term=.0b508caecfeb …

text: Mark Harris says "my 27-year-old son" is "a little judgmental and has a little taste of arrogance and some other things. And I'm very proud of him and and love him with all my heart." #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: North Carolina State Board of Elections chairman Bob Cordle asks Mark Harris, incredulously: "You didn’t believe these emails were an attempt by John to warn you of problems with Mr. Dowless?" #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Harris says he thought at the time of his son's warnings that John Harris was "overreacting." #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: .@marcelias just told me he paid taxes in Minnesota when he was lawyering Al Franken during that seven-month recount drama. He and I are both hoping he won't have to pay taxes in North Carolina this year. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Here is the key section of the letter to Mark Harris from the state election board's lawyer, Josh Lawson, dropped this morning and signaling serious legal troubles for Harris and his lawyers. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: "My son was still my son" -- Harris's explanation why he didn't seize on John Harris's concerns. He was a 27-year-old lawyer living in DC who hadn't met McCrae Dowless. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Lots of references by John Harris and Mark Harris about Beth Harris, Mark's wife and John's mom. She was heavily involved. Mark Harris described the decision to step down from pastoring at 1st Baptist Charlotte and run as the biggest step of their 31-year marriage. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Harris is asked about his son's email back in April 2017 in which he exhorted him to make sure he'd be comfortable with Dowless's tactics being broadcast on the TV news. Harris: "My son was a bit prophetic in his statement that day." #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Harris describes why he believed in Dowless. He had relationships and voters knew him and trusted him. In Bladen County, he said, "A lot of the folks are related to each other." #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Harris describes meeting McCrae Dowless in April 2017 at  Ray Britt's furniture store. A "good old boy" who "ate, slept and drank politics." They sat on couches in the showroom, and Harris asked this fateful question: "What makes you so special? What is it that you do?" #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Mark Harris takes the stand. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: well of course this should have said LOOM in their future.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Board member Jeff Carmon, a lawyer from Durham: "It is a disgrace to our profession" that the emails were not disclosed by the campaign's lawyers. #nc09 /3
author: AmyEGardner

text: John Branch, worth remembering, represented McCrae Dowless -- and former governor Pat McCrory -- at that fateful hearing in December 2016 when Dowless admitted his illegal tactics. #nc09 /2
author: AmyEGardner

text: Three board members are now expressing serious concern about Harris lawyers' handling of the subpoenas. Two of those lawyers just went out of their way to say they had nothing to do with production. that may leave one of them, John Branch, hanging in the wind. #nc09/1
author: AmyEGardner

text: Good thing this hearing is taking place in the N.C. State Bar building. We can transition seamlessly to the disciplinary hearings that appear to loop in the future for Dr. Harris's lawyers....#nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: And cue @marcelias. "We are in the third day of a one-day hearing and records are still being produced that are explosively important to the facts of the matter." #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Also, untold story: Judge Marion Warren, the former head of the Administrative Office of the Courts, now a dean at Regent University law school, was heavily involved in connecting Harris to Dowless. The reach of this investigation is growing. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Mark Harris's troubles are deepening this morning, as board lawyers explain that he did not hand over all subpoenaed emails. Board lawyer Josh Lawson said Harris's lawyers handed over the emails with Harris's son 15 mins before John Harris took the stand yesterday. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Key Q today not playing out inside the hearing today: Where is the state GOP establishment this morning? Angry at Harris? Feeling like he lied to them? And does this change the partisan dynamics that could play out when the board votes to certify or call a new election? #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Good morning, Twitter! #nc09 Day 4 starts now. First up on the witness stand: Mark Harris. Follow me for updates. And here's my piece from yesterday:
author: AmyEGardner

text: "Prodigal father" is the headline on the magazine piece, maybe? https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/candidates-son-warned-father-of-nc-political-operatives-tactics/2019/02/20/a1fbfecc-3521-11e9-a400-e481bf264fdc_story.html?utm_term=.51303d591344 … #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: My take on a very dramatic day in NC election hearing, where a heartbroken son (and federal prosecutor) came forward to say he warned his father, Mark Harris, not to hire McCrae Dowless: https://wapo.st/2T6zict  #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Dramatic takeaway from Day 3 of elex hearing in Raleigh: A heartbroken son who believed he had to come forward with evidence that his father should have known what McCrae Dowless was doing. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Mark Harris begins testimony at 9 a.m. ... game starts at 9 p.m. tonight. There will be a lot of weary souls shuffling into the hearing room tomorrow morning, methinks. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text:
Elias: And you wanted to be clear that this could all blow up and be referred to the D.A.
Harris: Yes. 2/2
author: AmyEGardner

text:
Heart-wrenching glimpse into mother/father-son relationship playing out in #nc09 hearing.
John Harris: I thought what he was doing was illegal, & I was right.
Marc Elias: & you were also concerned about your parents' well-being.
Harris: Absolutely /1
author: AmyEGardner

text: John Harris just mentioned the Duke-Carolina game tonight, which of course prompted me to see where he went to school. UNC 2012 and UNC Law 2015. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: John Harris advised his father, regarding McCrae Dowless, in an April 2017 email: "Good test is if you're comfortable with the full process he uses being broadcast on the news." #ncpol
author: AmyEGardner

text: John Harris just testified that he believes his dad believed Dowless when he said he was following the law. "I just didn’t believe McCrae because the numbers didn’t add up." #ncpol
author: AmyEGardner

text: Mark Harris also said this: Interestingly enough, the guy who made the claim, Dowless, is the same guy that Johnson paid to run the "absentee-ballot program" for him -- quotes are Harris's. #ncpol /2
author: AmyEGardner

text: NC elex officials just produced an email from Mark Harris to his son in 2016 joking about the fact that McCrae Dowless had filed a protest alleging Democratic fraud that year. "Guess he didn't like the Dems cutting into his business!" he wrote. #nc09 /1
author: AmyEGardner

text: John Harris, Mark's son, just said he scrutinized AB results in 2016 when his dad lost the primary to Pittenger, noticed "batching" of ballots arriving by mail. "At that point I began to be concerned that somebody was down there collecting the ballots." And: told his dad. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Yowza. John Harris, Mark Harris's son and an assistant U.S. attorney who works for Bobby Higdon in the eastern district of NC, told Andy Yates in April or May of 2017 that he'd heard McCrae Dowless was a "shady character." #ncpol
author: AmyEGardner

text: Turns out Dowless collected way fewer ballot request forms than he told Yates (the legal activity that he was paid for). Why didn't Andy Yates audit those #s? Yates said it just wasn't his practice. Dems say it's because it's not what Harris was really paying Dowless for. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: The lawyer for a Democratic judicial candidate swept up in #nc09 fraud investigation is doing some meaningful legwork for his party, pushing Andy Yates to admit that absentee ballot programs benefit the entire ticket. (Ergo fraud also can taint the whole ticket)...
author: AmyEGardner

text: SBE board chairman is not allowing Harris lawyer to get Andy Yates to say that many many officials were "led to believe" that Dowless was running a "lawful" operation. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Harris lawyer Alex Dale is trying to get Andy Yates to say he has no reason to doubt the NRCC's denial that they were warned about irregularities, but he's kind of not really willing to agree. #nc09. Here's the story with that denial: https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/republican-officials-had-early-warnings-of-voting-irregularities-in-north-carolina/2018/12/06/b3e5c6d4-f8bf-11e8-8c9a-860ce2a8148f_story.html …
author: AmyEGardner

text: If this elections board hearing proves one thing, it's that I'm losing my personal crusade to reverse the acceptance of using "impact" as a verb. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Harris lawyers are spending a lot of time talking about the Bladen Improvement PAC, a group that does GOTV for Democratic candidates and has been accused in the past of similar ballot-harvesting methods. The group is not currently under investigation by the SBE. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Harris lawyer Alex Dale is trying to shred one red flag, noting that "unusual" AB totals in 2016 primary could have resulted from an "active absentee ballot program," not "illegality." He's not really asking Andy Yates Qs, just stating things to prompt "Yes sirs." #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Today's hearing title: All the Campaign's Red Flags. @marceelias just walked Andy Yates through McCrae Dowless's December 2016 testimony to the SBE (first published shortly after that hearing). Yates admitted that what Dowless described is improper. #nc09.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Interesting: No win bonus for McCrae Dowless, as had been rumored in one of the affidavits from Bladen County, according to Andy Yates. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: He is also claiming that he never knew of a This American Life podcast episode all about McCrae Dowless. And he is claiming that those Republicans who knew of Dowless's methods, even as they failed to mention those methods, urged him to hire Dowless for Harris's campaign. /3
author: AmyEGardner

text: So basically: Andy Yates is claiming he didn't know that Dowless had incriminated himself at a 2016 election. He is claiming that the GOP officials, including Dallas Woodhouse (who all knew about 2016 and even attended the 2016 hearing), never mentioned any of it. /2
author: AmyEGardner

text: First up: An interesting admission by Andy Yates, Mark Harris's consultant who remains on the stand this morning. Yates says he saw none of the red flags about McCrae Dowless -- and admits that if he had, it would have required him to intervene. #nc09 /1
author: AmyEGardner

text: Hello Twitter! I'm back in the hearing room in Raleigh, N.C., for Day 3 of the #nc09 evidentiary hearing. Follow me for updates throughout the day.
author: AmyEGardner

text: I was just reading an old clip from December, when @DallasWoodhouse, chief of the NC GOP, told reporters that if the early-vote results were prematurely shared, “that is a fundamental violation of the sanctity of fair elections,” and a new election would have to be called. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Andy Yates testifies that he was actually surprised that Mark Harris didn't do better in the absentee-ballot vote in Bladen County. Dowless  had worked so hard on the absentee-ballot chase program, he said. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: And now come the much tougher questions from @marceelias for Andy Yates, clearly designed to raise the overall question: How could you NOT have known? #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Andy Yates, the general consultant for Mark Harris who paid McCrae Dowless, doesn't know how much of the $120k Dowless earned last year was for his absentee ballot chase program. No record-keeping or itemization. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Finally, Mrs. Harris said in her text to me back in December: "Please be sure that you clearly understand the difference between absentee ballot application and the actual absentee ballot." #ncpol /4
author: AmyEGardner

text: She continued: "It was a job, as there could be several hundred a day district wide. I was never on the ground in Bladen with any type of absentee application program." #nc09 /3
author: AmyEGardner

text: As Mrs. Harris told me in a text message back in December: "I downloaded the daily list of voters whose absentee ballots were mailed district wide and from our main headquarters we had volunteers who prepared campaign materials to send to each voter by first class mail." #nc09 /2
author: AmyEGardner

text: State elex officials are showing emails between Beth Harris and Andy Yates, a reminder of the very central role Mark Harris's wife played in monitoring her husband's progress in absentee-ballot voting in #nc09. /1
author: AmyEGardner

text: Mark Harris general consultant Andy Yates said he is "deeply disturbed" by the testimony implicating McCrae Dowless in election fraud in #NC09. He would have fired him immediately or resigned and reported the activity to the state board had he known during the campaign, he said.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Yates is a confident witness and makes it all sound so normal, like there was no reason to see red flags in Dowless's methods. He never demanded receipts for expenses, nor evidence for the number of ballot request forms he was submitting. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Yates: Dowless liked to get his checks hand delivered, not mailed. But never asked to be paid in cash. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Fun fact: Mark Harris general consultant Andy Yates said he paid Dowless for various GOTV functions, including staffing the Beast of Bladenboro festival. What is that, you ask? #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Worth noting that Mitchell Edwards, whose testimony is being a little bit shredded by Agnes Willis, is still here. He is likely to be called back to revisit whether he improperly saw the sheriff's early-vote tallies. Here he is outside the hearing room in blue shirt. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: And finally, we know Tojie King is white because the shift list for early-voting lists the race of everybody working that day. Again, wish I knew what that was about /4
author: AmyEGardner

text: Willis, who witnessed early-vote tape being illegally scrutinized by four or five poll workers the Saturday before elex day, said one of those workers, a white man named Tojie King, said, "OMG I thought the black guy had that," with his finger pointing to sheriff's race. /3
author: AmyEGardner

text: And it seems that we're seeing evidence that in some ways the irregularities in Bladen County had more to do with the sheriff's race than Mark Harris v. Dan McCready. #nc09 /2
author: AmyEGardner

text: We're now getting at some racial undercurrents in Bladen County. Polll worker Agnes Willis is explaining why the sheriff's race was "hot" -- because the incumbent, Jim McVicker, is white, "older, seasoned," and the challenger, Hakeem Brown, was a "younger, black" man. #nc09  /1
author: AmyEGardner

text: NEW: Top Trump appointees promoted selling nuclear power plants to Saudi Arabia over objections from national security officials, House Democratic report says, from @thamburger and @StevenMufson
author: AmyEGardner

text: Bladen poll worker Agnes Willis is contradicting the testimony of the chief poll judge who testified before her, Mitchell Edwards. A whole group of poll workers looked at the results while one of them had his finger on the numbers, she said.  #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: NEWS: four or five poll workers looked at the results of the Bladen County sheriff's early vote tallies, according to poll worker Agnes Willis. "I didn't come in here to lie. I came here to tell the truth." #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Someone has speculated this may be a relic of Voting Rights Act supervision requirements. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: No one is explaining why the shift sheet for Bladen County early vote poll workers says “Black” or “White” next to each name. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: NC elex board chairman Bob Cordle has just informed us that he's wearing his Davidson Wildcats tie today and the game starts at 6 p.m. ... excellent news all the way around. #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: We are now waiting for the actual tape. I think a tape-curling demonstration is coming.
author: AmyEGardner

text: We are now officially in hanging chad country. Marc Elias is asking poll worker how he could have seen sheriff's race results but no others, given the way the results tape curls up and the sheriff's numbers are "smack dab in the middle." #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text:
Amazing exchange on lack of elex training/oversight in Bladen, where poll workers improperly printed early vote tally b4 election day.
Strach: Do you now understand that’s not the way we do it?
Edwards: I haven’t been told that until you just said it.
Strach: I think you will be.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Coy Mitchell Edwards has taken stand in #nc09 hearing - poll judge who (illegally) ran early voting results tape the Saturday before the November election. He said he was trained to do it. Recipe for fraud, but still no evidence of intentional sharing of tape with candidates.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Everyone is watching the giant federal case in Cleveland, but the first real test of who's going to pay for the opioid epidemic—and how much--is set for Oklahoma state court. It's coming soon and will be televised. Our story:
author: AmyEGardner

text: As we head into Day 2 of the NC election fraud hearing, here's my take from Day 1, ICYMI: https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/nc-election-officials-harris-operative-collected-and-falsified-ballots-then-tried-to-obstruct-state-investigation/2019/02/18/6501347a-339a-11e9-854a-7a14d7fec96a_story.html?utm_term=.3a48da2f0702 … #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Today I was lucky enough to get my first edit from @TrishWbelli in .. how many years? On Friday it was @john_drescher. Seeing a pattern here? N&O revolution on K Street!
author: AmyEGardner

text: McCrae Dowless just refused to testify and the board will assume an “adverse inference” as a result when it considers what to do in this case. #nc09 #ncpol
author: AmyEGardner

text: The NC state board has just gone into closed session to discuss whether they will compel McCrae Dowless to testify -- and whether that means he would have immunity from criminal prosecution as a result.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Wow. McCrae Dowless  has just been called.
author: AmyEGardner

text: On display at this hearing in Raleigh: the economic hardship in eastern NC. Current witness, Kelly Hendrix, wept while describing how kind McCrae Dowless was to her. He gave her gas $$ and rides to her job at Hardee's b4 asking her to help collect ballots illegally. #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: At nearly 4 p.m. on Day 1, the state board just called its second witness, from a list of scores. Not sure I packed enough clothes this trip ...  #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Halfway thru Day 1 of NC-09 hearing in Raleigh, here's my take on the state of play:
author: AmyEGardner

text: It's getting contentious between Elias and Britt, and Chairman Bob Cordle just told Elias to slow down and let Britt answer.
author: AmyEGardner

text: "I want to get back to the ink" -- Elias. Gonna be a long week. #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Marc Elias just tripped up Lisa Britt -- got her to admit that she knew what she was doing was illegal. She said this morning she only found that out after the election. #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Asked by Marc Elias, Lisa Britt admits not knowing who Mark Harris was trying to unseat last year (Robert Pittenger). #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: .@marceelias starts questioning first witness Lisa Britt. Clearly trying to establish what Mark Harris knew. #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Lisa Britt "can't be 100% sure" but she just testified that Andy Yates, Mark Harris's consultant, knew of the ballot-tampering. She overheard calls between Yates and Dowless discussing how many ballots had been turned in for each candidate. #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: I'm not clear whether Lisa Britt was compelled to testify today or is doing so voluntarily. She's admitted to multiple felonies on the stand. Would have immunity if she was compelled to testify.  #ncpol #nc09.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Lisa Britt said she signed her mom's name sometimes so that she didn't raise a red flag by witnessing too many ballots herself, all in the presence of McCrae Dowless. #nc09 #ncpol
author: AmyEGardner

text: Under oath, campaign worker Lisa Britt admits filling out incomplete ballots for Republican candidates, at McCrae Dowless's direction.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Because this is where this election dispute could wind up...#ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Untold story here in Raleigh: Bit players, like the judicial candidates whose contest was also placed in limbo, had to hire lawyers on their own dime. One such lawyer told me the billable time to comply with the state board's subpoenas would make even a DC or NY law firm blush.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Star witness on the stand: Lisa Britt, McCrae Dowless's ex-step-daughter, just admitted voting in November despite being on probation for a felony. Now she's about to implicate Dowless. #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: NC elex chief Strach: Efforts were made to obstruct this investigation and the testimony provided at this hearing. #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: DANG: Red Dome, Harris's consultant, paid McCrae Dowless $131,375.57. #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: This is news. Strach: Blank or incomplete ballots were voted in Dowless’s home or office. #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: Strach: Dowless paid his workers $150 for every 50 absentee ballot request forms collected and $125 for every 50 absentee ballots collected.
author: AmyEGardner

text: Boom: State elex chief Kim Strach says McCrae Dowless hired workers to collect absentee ballots (a felony in NC) and to falsify ballot forms.
author: AmyEGardner

text: NC elex chief Kim Strach says we're going to hear about poor election security at Bladen County board of elex. This could be the road map to declaring the NC-09 results generally tainted. #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: NC elex chief Kim Strach says looking at absentee ballots is "not just about those that have been returned. It's about those that haven’t been returned." Direct blow to primary argument of NCGOP. #ncpol #nc09
author: AmyEGardner

text: The untold story in NC is that the General Assembly has been trying -- and failing -- to wrest control of the state board of elections from Democratic Gov. Roy Cooper. They want this investigation of election fraud in NC-09 to go away, but it's not gonna./1
